note: Mithridates invaded Bithynia. L. Lucullus given command against him. M. Antonius sent against the pirates.
title: Aurelius Cotta Nicomedes of Bithynia died and left his kingdom to Rome
Terentius Varro Lucullus and C. Cassius Longinus Revolt of Spartacus began
Gellius Publicola and Cn. Cornelius Lentulus Clodianus Crassus took command against Spartacus
Hortensius Hortalus and Q. Caecilius Metellus Creticus Lucullus invaded Armenia
Marcius Rex Mutiny of Lucullus’ army at Nisibis
Acilius Glabrio Pompey given command against pirates by lex Gabinia. Successful three-month campaign
Volcacius Tullus Pompey given command against Mithridates by lex Manilia
Manlius Torquatus Crassus and Catulus became censors
Marcius Figulus Cicero and Antonius Hybrida defeated Catiline in consular election

container-title: Pompey in Jerusalem. Death of Mithridates
title: Caesar elected pontifex maximus. Catilinarian Conspiracy. October SCU passed. December Cicero executed five Roman citizens without a trial using the power of the SCU
Licinius Murena Clodius involved in Bona Dea scandal
Aemilius Lepidus Agrippa married Julia
Silius Nerva Parthia returned Roman standards to Augustus
Augustus returned to Rome, given consular power for life

container-title: Agrippa given tribunician power. Julian marriage laws
title: Cornelius Lentulus Second Augustan review of the Senate. Property qualification for senators raised to one million sesterces. Renewal of Augustus’ control of the imperial provinces

Munatius Plancus Renewal of Augustus’ powers; Tiberius received equal imperium with Augustus across Empire. AD 14 Sex. Pompeius and Sex. Appuleius 19 August Death of Augustus. Killing of Agrippa Postumus. Augustus declared a god. Tiberius became Emperor.
